verses.kjv: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord that bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.
verses.ct: Just as there were false prophets among the people of Israel, there will also be false teachers among you. They will secretly introduce destructive lies, even rejecting the Lord who redeemed them, and will bring rapid destruction on themselves.

verses.kjv: And many shall follow their pernicious ways; by reason of whom the way of truth shall be evil spoken of.
verses.ct: Many people will follow their shameful behavior, and because of them, the way of truth will be slandered.

verses.kjv: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not.
verses.ct: In their greed, they will exploit you with made-up stories. Their condemnation was pronounced long ago and has not been idle, and their destruction has not been sleeping.

verses.kjv: For if God spared not the angels that sinned, but cast them down to hell, and delivered them into chains of darkness, to be reserved unto judgment;
verses.ct: After all, God did not spare the angels who sinned but threw them into hell, locking them in chains of darkness to be held until judgment.

verses.kjv: And spared not the old world, but saved Noah the eighth person, a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;
verses.ct: He did not spare the ancient world either, but protected Noah, a proclaimer of righteousness, along with 7 others, when he brought the flood on a world full of ungodly people.

verses.kjv: And turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha into ashes condemned them with an overthrow, making them an ensample unto those that after should live ungodly;
verses.ct: He reduced the cities of Sodom and Gomorrha to ashes, condemning them to total ruin as a warning to anyone who would live an ungodly life afterward.

verses.kjv: And delivered just Lot, vexed with the filthy conversation of the wicked:
verses.ct: But he rescued Lot, a righteous man who was deeply troubled by the disgusting behavior of the wicked people around him.

verses.kjv: (For that righteous man dwelling among them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds;)
verses.ct: (Living among them day after day, that righteous man was tormented in his soul by the lawless things he saw and heard.)

verses.kjv: The Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations, and to reserve the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punished:
verses.ct: So the Lord knows how to rescue godly people from trials, and how to hold the unrighteous for punishment on the day of judgment—

verses.kjv: But chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government. Presumptuous are they, selfwilled, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities.
verses.ct: especially those who chase after corrupt physical desires and show contempt for authority. These people are bold and arrogant, not even hesitating to insult glorious beings.

verses.kjv: Whereas angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not railing accusation against them before the Lord.
verses.ct: Yet angels, who are far greater in strength and power, do not bring slanderous accusations against such beings in the Lord's presence.

verses.kjv: But these, as natural brute beasts, made to be taken and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they understand not; and shall utterly perish in their own corruption;
verses.ct: But these people are like irrational animals, creatures of instinct born to be caught and killed. They slander things they don't understand, and they will be destroyed right along with those things.

verses.kjv: And shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;
verses.ct: They will be paid back with harm for the harm they have caused. They consider it a pleasure to party in broad daylight. They are stains and defects among you, reveling in their deceptions while they eat alongside you at your gatherings.

verses.kjv: Having eyes full of adultery, and that cannot cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart they have exercised with covetous practices; cursed children:
verses.ct: Their eyes are always looking for adultery, and they never stop sinning. They lure in people who are not yet firmly grounded. Their hearts are trained in greed. They are people under a curse.

verses.kjv: Which have forsaken the right way, and are gone astray, following the way of Balaam the son of Bosor, who loved the wages of unrighteousness;
verses.ct: They have abandoned the straight path and wandered off, following the example of Balaam son of Bosor, who loved getting paid for doing wrong.

verses.kjv: But was rebuked for his iniquity: the dumb ass speaking with man’s voice forbad the madness of the prophet.
verses.ct: But he was confronted for his sin when a donkey—an animal without speech—spoke with a human voice and put a stop to the prophet's madness.

verses.kjv: These are wells without water, clouds that are carried with a tempest; to whom the mist of darkness is reserved for ever.
verses.ct: These people are like dried-up springs and clouds blown around by a storm. The deepest darkness has been set aside for them forever.

verses.kjv: For when they speak great swelling words of vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, through much wantonness, those that were clean escaped from them who live in error.
verses.ct: They use impressive but empty words to appeal to people's physical desires and immoral cravings, drawing in those who have barely escaped from others who live in deception.

verses.kjv: While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption: for of whom a man is overcome, of the same is he brought in bondage.
verses.ct: They promise freedom to these people, but they themselves are slaves to corruption—because whatever controls you is what enslaves you.

verses.kjv: For if after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, they are again entangled therein, and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.
verses.ct: If people have escaped the moral filth of the world through knowing our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, but then get tangled up in it again and are overpowered by it, they end up worse off than they were before.

verses.kjv: For it had been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than, after they have known it, to turn from the holy commandment delivered unto them.
verses.ct: It would have been better for them never to have known the way of righteousness than to know it and then turn their backs on the holy command that was passed on to them.

verses.kjv: But it is happened unto them according to the true proverb, The dog is turned to his own vomit again; and the sow that was washed to her wallowing in the mire.
verses.ct: What has happened to them proves the truth of the proverb: 'A dog returns to its own vomit,' and, 'A pig that has been washed goes back to rolling in the mud.'
